Articles.Content:
Hi all, I recently bought KSP and instantly fell in love with it. I launched a few crafts in orbit and to the moons, but not much more. I'm looking forward to going on bigger missions and maybe even have something useful to contribute to the forums

Furthermore I'm an astronomy student so this kind of fits right it

Welcome to the forums!

Looking forward to see what you're going to show us

Welcome to the forums!

KSP is definitely one of those games that's hard to let go of once you've picked it up. I'll personally testify that it's been one of the very few games in a long, long time that I've actually found worth playing over and over again, just for the sheer amount of stuff it lets you try out.

Feel free to jump into any conversation that interests you around the forums. I'd also advise checking out the Drawing Board (link in my sig), which has tons of links to tutorials and other useful information. If you have questions about how to pull off a particularly tricky mission, the people over in the "How To" forum will always be more than happy to share their knowledge.

Happy landings!
